subject: Re: [junit] Parameterized test case pattern
msgSnippet: ... I mean:  how come the test fails if you fail to call the super constructor with a string? It s so counterintuitive that it tripped even Elliotte...  (and
messageBody:
On 11/13/05, Eugene Kuleshov <eu@...> wrote:
>
> Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
>
> >> I've posted it here some time ago. Your example is missing the test
> >> name:
> >>
> >> public DataDrivenTest(int i) {
> >> super("testFoo");
> >> this.i = i;
> >> }
> >
> > What's the justification for this?
>
> Justification? This is just how JUnit resolve test cases.


I mean: how come the test fails if you fail to call the super constructor
with a string?

It's so counterintuitive that it tripped even Elliotte... (and myself many
times).


--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
